attributes.action: Pub Landlords are calling for an immediate freeze on business rates
attributes.additional_details:
1. An immediate freeze on current business rates at the November budget to make time for an URGENT FUNDAMENTAL REVIEW of the whole system
2. Public Houses want a new formula on the way their rates are calculated. Must be fair to all pub models as the current system is unfit for purpose.
3. Special consideration for pubs and small businesses to encourage growth paid for by higher rates on larger businesses.
4. A cap on the % increase that can be made on Rateable Value Revaluations (every 5 years)
attributes.background:
TO THE CHANCELLOR OF THE EXCHEQUER
 
We, the pub landlords are calling for
 
1. An immediate freeze on current business rates at the November budget 2017 to give the Government time to have an URGENT FUNDAMENTAL REVIEW of the whole system.

rejection.details:
We're not sure whether you want business rates to be frozen and reviewed for all businesses, or only for pubs.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
